column4: how come when using "less" cmd to view .php file, everything is one line? not easy to view. what's the best way to view .php from terminal?
because your .php file hasn't got any line breaks
it sounds like your .php file has no line breaks in it
can you upload the offending file somewhere?
it has line breaks. nano can view all the line breaks but not vim or less
then it may have Windows line breaks - do you see lots of "^M" in it?
okay, then you have DOS-like line endings
open the file in vi/vim and try something like ":%s/<CTRL-V><CTRL-M>//g
when you type "<CTRL-V><CTRL-M>" it should show up as "^M" and highlighted
it says pattern not found. I'll check back later to see how to get around the dos line break
there's a program called something like dos2unix
did you type the ^M as Control-V followed by Control-M like I said?
yeah ^M like u said went away but no line breaks can is displayed. still all in one line.
well, that's your problem right enough; you need to convert the ^Ms to proper line breaks
look at DOS to Unix conversion
ok. i'll try to install dos2unix and run it on .php so i can view it right in vim
